title: How to Make a Spaghetti Sandwich

steps.headline: Melt the butter and garlic powder.
steps.description: In a large frying pan or skillet, melt together the butter and garlic powder until fully melted and the butter starts to bubble slightly.

steps.headline: Spread the butter over the bread.
steps.description: Using a pastry brush, dip the brush into the melted butter mixture and spread it all over the two slices of bread.

steps.headline: Mix the spaghetti sauce with the spaghetti.
steps.description: In a medium-sized bowl, combine the spaghetti sauce with the spaghetti noodles. Mix with a wooden spoon until properly combined.

steps.headline: Make the sandwiches.
steps.description: Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over one of the slices of bread Carefully add the spaghetti noodles on top. Close the sandwich with the other slice of bread.

steps.headline: Grill the sandwich.
steps.description: Preheat the stove top on to medium heat. Lay the same frying pan or skillet you used to melt the butter. Place the spaghetti sandwich on the pan and have it fry for until the bread is crisped on both sides, usually taking about 5 minutes for each side.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Cut the sandwich into two slices and serve them on a serving plate. Heat up any extra spaghetti sauce to dip the sandwich in. Sprinkle extra mozzarella cheese if desired.

text: Melt the butter and garlic powder. In a large frying pan or skillet, melt together the butter and garlic powder until fully melted and the butter starts to bubble slightly. Spread the butter over the bread. Using a pastry brush, dip the brush into the melted butter mixture and spread it all over the two slices of bread. Mix the spaghetti sauce with the spaghetti. In a medium-sized bowl, combine the spaghetti sauce with the spaghetti noodles. Mix with a wooden spoon until properly combined. Make the sandwiches. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over one of the slices of bread Carefully add the spaghetti noodles on top. Close the sandwich with the other slice of bread. Grill the sandwich. Preheat the stove top on to medium heat. Lay the same frying pan or skillet you used to melt the butter. Place the spaghetti sandwich on the pan and have it fry for until the bread is crisped on both sides, usually taking about 5 minutes for each side. Serve. Cut the sandwich into two slices and serve them on a serving plate. Heat up any extra spaghetti sauce to dip the sandwich in. Sprinkle extra mozzarella cheese if desired. Enjoy!
